page.title: 04ECOLOGY
page.content: Ashover is in the Peak District Nation al Park and on the south-east edge of the Pennines.The area has many valleys In the Peak district there is a high persentage of Heather,Bilberry and Sillceous grassland with gorse,bracon and rhodedendron etc growing profusely.At Wire Stone Moor there is a plantation of only fir trees,which are Evergreen,but no young ones have been planted recently.There is quite a big moor near the picnic site.Around Hodglane Brook there are evergreen and deciduous trees to the west but at Smally Brook they are only deciduous. The local planning authoraties have given a priority to the conservation of natrual history resources in our area.The planning authoraties won't let any motorways go through Ashover because it would frighten all the animals away.
